EXERCISE STRESS TEST
PROCEDURE :
The patient was exercised by continuous graded treadmill for 15 min 00 Sec of the Bruce
protocol.
SYMPTOMS :
Exercise stopped due to THR achieved. No chest pain.
HEART RATE/BLOOD PRESSURE :
The heart rate rose from 85 beats/min at rest to a maximum of 196 beats/min at peak
exercise, which is the predicted maximum heart rate for an individual this age. The blood
pressure increased from 120/80 mmHg at rest to 170/80 mmHg peak exercise.
ELECTROCARDIOGRAM :
Resting ECG showed sinus rhythm, there were no ST-T changes observed during exercise
and recovery period.
ARRHYTHMIAS :
No arrhythmias noted during exercise.
CONCLUSIONS :
Exercise ECG is NEGATIVE for ischemia.
